Another subspecies, C.Â n.Â abingdonii, became extinct on 24 June 2012 with the death in captivity of the last remaining specimen, a male named Lonesome George, the world's "rarest living creature".[111] All the other surviving subspecies are listed by the IUCN as at least "Vulnerable" in conservation status, if not worse.
